intro: Ossaea leucandra, commonly known as the white ossaea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late summer. Its leaves are finely divided and have a peppery scent when crushed. Ossaea leucandra is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
